semantic_title: See and See Also Instructions in Alphabetic Index Navigation
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 16. 'See' and 'See Also'

content.full_text: The "see" instruction following a main term in the Alphabetic Index indicates that another term should be referenced. It is necessary to go to the main term referenced with the "see" note to locate the correct code. A "see also" instruction following a main term in the Alphabetic Index instructs that there is another main term that may also be referenced that may provide additional Alphabetic Index entries that may be useful. It is not necessary to follow the "see also" note when the original main term provides the necessary code. (Evidence: pg no: 11-12, L60-L64)
content.summary: See instructions require following the reference to find the correct code, while See Also instructions are optional additional references (Evidence: pg no: 11-12, L60-L64)
key_concepts: See instruction requires following reference (Evidence: pg no: 11, L60-L61)
Must go to referenced main term (Evidence: pg no: 11, L61)
See Also is optional additional reference (Evidence: pg no: 11-12, L62-L63)
See Also may provide additional useful entries (Evidence: pg no: 11-12, L63)
Not necessary to follow See Also if original term sufficient (Evidence: pg no: 12, L64)

detailed_rules.rule_text: See instruction must be followed to locate correct code (Evidence: pg no: 11, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: See instruction indicates the current term does not have the code and reference must be followed (Evidence: pg no: 11, L60-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: See Also instruction is optional when original term provides necessary code (Evidence: pg no: 12, L64)
detailed_rules.explanation: See Also provides additional options but is not required if original term is sufficient (Evidence: pg no: 11-12, L62-L64)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify See or See Also instruction
Step 2: For See - must follow reference to find code
Step 3: For See Also - evaluate if additional reference needed
Step 4: Use original term if sufficient for See Also
Step 5: Follow See Also if additional specificity needed

warnings: Must follow See instructions to locate correct code (Evidence: pg no: 11, L60-L61)
best_practices: Always follow See instructions (Evidence: pg no: 11, L60-L61)
Consider See Also instructions for additional specificity (Evidence: pg no: 11-12, L62-L63)
common_mistakes: Ignoring See instructions and missing correct code
Following See Also unnecessarily when original term sufficient
tips: See is mandatory, See Also is optional
See Also may provide more specific options
implementation_notes: Part of Alphabetic Index navigation system
clinical_context: Helps with synonym and related term navigation
